name: gyokuro
citation: Wikipedia contributors. (2018, January 6). Gyokuro. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 00:11, March 6, 2018, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Gyokuro&oldid=818860667
description: Gyokuro is a type of shaded green tea from Japan. It differs from the standard sencha (a classic unshaded green tea) in being grown under the shade rather than the full sun. Gyokuro is shaded longer than kabuse tea. While gyokuro is shaded for approximately three weeks, kabuse-cha is shaded for approximately one week. The name gyokuro translates as jewel dew (or jade dew, referring to the pale green colour of the infusion).

name: sencha
citation: Wikipedia contributors. (2018, January 16). Sencha. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 00:11, March 6, 2018, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Sencha&oldid=820757504
description: Sencha (煎茶) is a type of Japanese ryokucha (緑茶, green tea) which is prepared by infusing the processed whole tea leaves in hot water. This is as opposed to matcha (抹茶), powdered Japanese green tea, where the green tea powder is mixed with hot water and therefore the leaf itself is included in the beverage. Sencha is the most popular tea in Japan.

name: darjeeling
citation: Wikipedia contributors. (2018, February 6). Darjeeling tea. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 00:10, March 6, 2018, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Darjeeling_tea&oldid=824299929
description: Darjeeling tea is a tea from the Darjeeling district in West Bengal, India. It is available in black, green, white and oolong. When properly brewed, it yields a thin-bodied, light-coloured infusion with a floral aroma. The flavour can include a tinge of astringent tannic characteristics and a musky spiciness sometimes described as muscatel.

name: nilgiri
citation: Wikipedia contributors. (2017, December 6). Nilgiri tea. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 00:10, March 6, 2018, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Nilgiri_tea&oldid=814051591
description: Nilgiri tea is generally described as being a dark, intensely aromatic, fragrant and flavoured tea grown in the southern portion of the Western Ghats mountains of Southern India. It is grown in the hills of the Nilgiris district of Tamil Nadu, though there are numerous other tea-growing districts in South India as well, including Munnar and Central Travancore, further south in Kerala state.

name: tieguanyin
citation: Wikipedia contributors. (2018, March 2). Tieguanyin. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 00:09, March 6, 2018, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Tieguanyin&oldid=828432803
description: AKA Iron Buddha Tea - Tieguanyin is a premium variety of Chinese oolong tea originated in the 19th century in Anxi in Fujian province. Tieguanyin produced in different areas of Anxi have different gastronomic characteristics.

name: da hong pao
citation: Wikipedia contributors. (2018, March 2). Da Hong Pao. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 00:08, March 6, 2018, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Da_Hong_Pao&oldid=828432461
description: AKA Big Red Robe Tea - Da Hong Pao (Big Red Robe) is a Wuyi rock tea grown in the Wuyi Mountains. It is a heavily oxidized, dark oolong tea. In recent years, a number of companies have invested in preserving the interest in this tea and other so-called artisan teas, which typically are of very high quality and have rich histories as is true with Da Hong Pao. These have an initially high cost of production (and typically are only considered authentic when grown in their place of origin), but, as they have quickly become popular in Western countries, prized selections of the tea are available each year, with quality being consistent because of the increased popularity of the tea.

name: bai mudan
citation: Wikipedia contributors. (2018, March 2). Bai Mudan. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 00:07, March 6, 2018, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Bai_Mudan&oldid=828372599
description: Bai Mudan (Chinese: 白牡丹; pinyin: bái mǔdān; Wade–Giles: pai2 mu3-tan1; literally: white peony, pronounced [pǎi mù.tán]) is a type of white tea made from plucks each with one leaf shoot and two immediate young leaves.[1] Bai Mudan is sometimes preferred by white tea drinkers for its fuller flavor and greater potency than the other major type of white tea, Bai Hao Yinzhen. The latter is made purely with leaf shoots, and so it is comparatively softer and more subtle.

name: chamomile
citation: Wikipedia contributors. (2018, February 26). Chamomile. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 00:03, March 6, 2018, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Chamomile&oldid=827782168
description: Chamomile tea is an herbal infusion made from dried chamomile flowers and hot water. Two types of chamomile used are: German chamomile (Matricaria recutita) and Roman chamomile (Chamaemelum nobile). One recipe calls for 2 to 3 heaped teaspoons of the flowers, steeped for 10–20 minutes and then strained.

name: chai
citation: Wikipedia contributors. (2018, March 1). Masala chai. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 23:58, March 5, 2018, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Masala_chai&oldid=828265354
description: Masala chai (/tʃaɪ/; Hindi: मसाला चाय, literally mixed-spice tea; Urdu: مصالحہ چائے‬‎) is a flavoured tea beverage made by brewing black tea with a mixture of aromatic Indian spices and herbs. Originating in the Indian subcontinent, the beverage has gained worldwide popularity, becoming a feature in many coffee and tea houses.

name: shoumei
citation: Wikipedia contributors. (2018, March 2). Shoumei tea. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 00:02, March 6, 2018, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Shoumei_tea&oldid=828374263
description: Shoumei (simplified Chinese: 寿眉; traditional Chinese: 壽眉; pinyin: shòuméi; Cantonese Yale: sauh méi; Standard Chinese pronunciation [ʂôu.měi]) is a white tea that is produced from naturally withered upper leaf and tips, with a stronger flavor reminiscent of lighter oolong teas. It is mostly grown in Fujian Province and Guangxi Province in China.[1] Because it is plucked later than Bai Mudan, the tea may be darker in color, but it should still have a proportionate green color.

name: matcha
citation: Wikipedia contributors. (2018, February 26). Matcha. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 19:01, March 6, 2018, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Matcha&oldid=827681578
description: Matcha (抹茶, Japanese pronunciation pronounced [mat.tɕa], English /ˈmætʃə/[1][i]) is finely ground powder of specially grown and processed green tea leaves. It is special in two aspects of farming and processing: the green tea plants for matcha are shade-grown for about three weeks before harvest and the stems and veins are removed in processing. During shaded growth, the plant Camellia sinensis produces more theanine and caffeine. The powdered form of matcha is consumed differently from tea leaves or tea bags, and is dissolved in a liquid, typically water or milk.

name: earl grey
citation: Original Text, Photo: https://www.therighttea.com/ali-shan.html
description: Earl Grey tea is a tea blend which has been flavoured with the addition of oil of bergamot. Bergamot is a variety of orange that is often grown in Italy and France. The rind's fragrant oil is added to black tea to give Earl Grey its signature pungent punch. Traditionally, Earl Grey was made from black teas, but tea companies have since begun to offer Earl Grey in other varieties as well, such as green or oolong.

name: ali shan
citation: Original Text, Photo: https://www.therighttea.com/ali-shan.html
description: Because this tea is grown in higher altitudes (high mountains of Taiwan), the plant is forced to stress in order to grow, creating high concentrations of its antioxidants.

name: brahmi
citation: Original Text, Photo: https://www.upayanaturals.com/Bacopa_Monnieri_Brahmi_Certified_Organic_Tea_p/hrb-003.htm
description: Brahmi tea has been used for generations as a medicine. An Ayurvedic plant, knowng for enhancing the connection between neurons, creating a happy state of mind, relieving both stress and depression.

name: kukicha
citation: Wikipedia contributors. (2018, January 12). Kukicha. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 21:18, March 13, 2018, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Kukicha&oldid=819965962
description: Kukicha (茎茶), or twig tea, also known as bōcha (棒茶), is a Japanese blend made of stems, stalks, and twigs. It is available as a green tea or in more oxidised processing. Kukicha has a unique flavour and aroma among teas, due to its being composed of parts of the tea plant that are excluded from most other teas.

name: jin xuan
citation: Wikipedia contributors. (2017, December 21). Jin Xuan tea. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 21:27, March 13, 2018, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Jin_Xuan_tea&oldid=816534016
description: Jin Xuan (Chinese: 金萱; pinyin: jīn xuān; literally: Golden Daylily; is a variety of oolong tea developed in 1980. The tea is also known as #12 or as Milk Oolong (Nai Xiang). It originates from Taiwan. The taste is light, creamy, and flowery and sometimes compared to milk. This tea variety can be grown at higher altitudes, and the yield is about 20% higher compared to traditional tea varieties. These circumstances made it become one of the most popular varieties among tea farmers in Taiwan and Thailand.

name: coffee cherry
citation: Wikipedia contributors. (2018, March 7). Coffee cherry tea. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 21:36, March 13, 2018, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Coffee_cherry_tea&oldid=829256272
description: Coffee cherry tea is a herbal tea made from the dried skins of the coffee fruit. Often, it is more than the skins that are used, and include the dried berries (or cherries) of the coffee plant that remain after the coffee beans have been collected from within. It is also known as cascara, from the Spanish cáscara, meaning husk.

name: silver needle
citation: Wikipedia contributors. (2018, March 2). Baihao Yinzhen. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 21:45, March 13, 2018, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Baihao_Yinzhen&oldid=828432380
description: Silver Needle or Bai Hao Yin Zhen or usually just Yin Zhen is the Chinese type of white tea. Amongst white teas, this is the most expensive variety and the most prized, as only top buds (leaf shoots) are used to produce the tea.[2] Genuine Silver Needles are made from cultivars of the Da Bai (Large White) tea tree family.

name: golden monkey
citation: Wikipedia contributors. (2018, March 2). Golden Monkey tea. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 21:41, March 13, 2018, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Golden_Monkey_tea&oldid=828373086
description: Golden Monkey tea (Chinese: 金猴茶; pinyin: jīn hóu chá) is the name of a black tea originating from the Fujian and Yunnan provinces in China. Only the bud and first leaf are picked, and the tea leaves are characterized by the pale gold threading. The flavor profile of golden monkey tea is characterized by light, honeyed peach notes, and its lack of astringency.

name: cloud
citation: Wikipedia contributors. (2018, April 15). Cloud tea. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 21:17, April 19, 2018, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Cloud_tea&oldid=836544672
description: Cloud tea is named for being produced in clouds in Le Mountain (Chinese: 南岳山; pinyin: nányuè shān). Cloud tea belongs to green tea in the list of famous teas. With a standard of one bud, one leaf about 3 centimetres, it is usually picked from Grain Rain (6th solar term) to Beginning of Summer (7th solar term). After a series of complex processes, the finished tea looks beautiful and is full of lustre.

name: barley
citation: Wikipedia contributors. (2018, February 23). Barley tea. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 21:32, April 19, 2018, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Barley_tea&oldid=827209621
description: Barley tea is a roasted-grain-based infusion made from barley which is a staple across Korea, China, and Japan. It has a toasty flavor, with slight bitter undertones. In Korea, the tea is consumed either hot or cold, often taking the place of drinking water in many homes and restaurants. In Japan, it is usually served cold and is a popular summertime refreshment. The tea is also widely available in tea bags or bottled in Korea and Japan.

name: ginseng
citation: Wikipedia contributors. (2018, February 24). Ginseng tea. In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 21:38, April 19, 2018, from https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ginseng_tea&oldid=827415724
description: Ginseng tea is traditionally prepared with Korean ginseng along with jujubes and dried Korean chestnuts. These are decocted for several hours over a low heat, sweetened with honey, and served with Korean pine nuts floating on top. Either fresh ginseng or red ginseng can be used.
